body.draft-comment: This topic will describe how Webhelp templates works.

draft-comment.author: webapp
draft-comment.b: Create a special/separate index.html page for responsive webhelp

body.p: A WebHelp template component gives dynamics to the Webhelp template page. It is expanded differently depending on the context where it is placed or the current transformed DITA Map.

Some WebHelp template components could be used in all the template pages and some of them could be used in all pages. For instance, the Publication title could be used in all pages, but topic breadcrumb could be used only when expand the Webhelp topic template.

To output a such component you have to refer a specific element in template pages. All the elements associated with a template components should reside in the http://www.oxygenxml.com/webhelp/components namespace.

section.title: Publication Title [webhelp_publication_title]
section.p: This component is bound to the publication title and it can be used in all template pages.
To output this component in the Webhelp Responsive output you have to specify the element webhelp_publication_title in a template page. This component can be specified in all template pages.

body.section:
Publication logo [webhelp_logo]
This component can be used to emit a logo image in WebHelp Responsive output. It will be processed only when a logo image is specified through the webhelp.logo.image transformation parameter.
Additionally, you can set the webhelp.logo.image.target.url parameter to generate a link to an URL when you hover the logo image. If this parameter is not set, then a link to the home page will be automatically generated.
The element associated with this component is webhelp_logo and it can be specified in all template pages.
Sample
If you specify the next element in a template page:<whc:webhelp_logo xmlns:whc="http://www.oxygenxml.com/webhelp/components"/>and the transformation parameters:$webhelp.logo.image = logo.png $webhelp.logo.image.target.url = http://www.oxygenxml.com
you will find in the output an element with webhelp_logo class.

section.title: Topic content [webhelp_topic_content]
section.p: This component can be used in to generate the raw content of the topic (without any side components like breadcrumb or side toc). For DITA, it represent the content of the HTML files as they are produced by DITA-OT processor.
